Ask HN: I miss CTRL+ALT+DELETE, what's the Linux equivalent?
text:
I've been using Linux for most of my life, and the Windows feature I miss most is CTRL+ALT+DELETE for recovering from freezes.

When your Linux system freezes, what do you do to recover functionality?

(At the point a Linux system has frozen, it's usually too late to summon a command prompt with Ctrl+Alt+F3. The Magic SysRq Key seems like it should be able to duplicate the functionality of CTRL+ALT+DELETE — but so far I haven't successfully used it to recover from freezes, and it isn't usually enabled on friend's computers.)

title: Robots.txt
Ask HN: Transitioning from Front end to Back end
text:
Hello HN - long time lurker, first time poster.

In my 4-5 years as a developer I've always been in the frontend world, I have it enjoyed it and continue to enjoy it; however, I feel that the pool for frontend jobs is becoming more and more smaller. I don't mind keeping up with the latest tech, in fact that helps me my ADHD - new things always entice me. I like to think that I am good having joined a big tech company if that means anything.

Still I feel way to overspecialized, I would like to become "full-stack" with a frontend focus. I have read up on backend system design and find that interesting, lots of reading but no implementations (I have no real experience).

I would like to learn more about backend on the side, how would you guys go about doing this? Tutorial hell?

tldr; spent all my time on frontend, would like to learn backend, how should I go about doing this?

Ask HN: Is DeepTomCruise Fake?
text:
I'm really excited and curious about the capabilities of recent AI developments but also want to stay skeptical.

In the late 80s we had this series called Max Headroom where the namesake main character was supposedly computer generated but in reality was an actor in heavy make-up plus some effects. I wonder if DeepTomCruise is similar or really AI generated as it is claimed by its creators? The actor behind DeepTomCruise already looks quite a lot like the young Tom Cruise and I'm pretty sure good make-up, acting and a good deal of state-of-the-art post-processing could go a long way.

So, what are the chances machine learning was really necessary and useful in the production of these videos?

Creating a Personal Brand: How Social Media Can Help Your Small Business Grow
text:
Welcome to the world of social media, where personal branding is king and small businesses can thrive like never before. If you're a small business owner looking to gain more customers, then you've come to the right place. In this post, we're going to show you how creating a personal brand through social media platforms can help you take your business to the next level.
First things first, what is personal branding? Personal branding is the process of creating a unique image or reputation for yourself or your business through social media. This can be done by sharing interesting content, networking with other professionals, and building relationships with your customers.
But why is personal branding so important for small businesses? For starters, it can help you stand out from the competition. With so many small businesses vying for customers' attention on social media, it's important to have a unique and interesting brand that sets you apart from the rest.
Personal branding can also help you build trust with your customers. People are more likely to do business with someone they know and trust, and social media is the perfect platform for building those relationships. By sharing your story and providing valuable content, you can connect with your customers on a personal level and build a loyal following.
But how do you actually create a personal brand on social media? Here are a few tips to get you started:
Be consistent: Choose a consistent look and feel for your social media profiles and stick with it. This will make it easier for people to recognize and remember your brand.
Share interesting content: Share interesting and valuable content that is relevant to your customers. This will help you attract the right people to your business and keep them engaged.
Engage with your audience: Respond to comments and messages, and engage in conversations with your followers. This will help you build stronger relationships with your customers.
Show your personality: Remember, personal branding is all about being authentic and true to yourself. So don't be afraid to show your personality and let your customers get to know the real you.
Have fun with it! Personal branding doesn't have to be all work and no play. So don't be afraid to let loose and have a little fun with it.
In conclusion, creating a personal brand through social media can be a game-changer for small businesses. It can help you stand out from the competition, build trust with your customers, and ultimately, drive more sales. So what are you waiting for? Get out there and start building your personal brand today!
